references.paper_title: Can language models encode perceptual structure without grounding? A case study in color
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the study of implicit world models, exploring whether language models can capture underlying perceptual structures without explicit grounding.

references.paper_title: Chess as a testbed for language model state tracking
references.reason: This work introduced the influential approach of using board games as a concrete testbed for evaluating the implicit recovery of world models by large language models.

references.paper_title: Emergent world representations: Exploring a sequence model trained on a synthetic task
references.reason: This paper expands the game-playing approach to evaluate implicit world models to a broader set of tasks by using a synthetic data set.

references.paper_title: Finite automata and the representation of events
references.reason: The Myhill-Nerode theorem, introduced in this seminal paper, provides the theoretical foundation for the evaluation metrics proposed in this paper.

This paper, along with Myhill's work, provides the theoretical underpinning for the proposed evaluation metrics, focusing on the relationship between states and transitions in deterministic finite automata.
